description.narrative: 2.4 UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.4 UNICEF staff and partners are provided guidance, tools and resources to effectively plan and monitor programmes

description.narrative: Commitment of UNICEF and the Government to generate internationally comparable data resulted in endorsement of the MICS Committees and the plan and budget for the Survey. The research, studies and evaluations provided the solid evidence for the preparation of a new generation Situation Analysis on Children in Uzbekistan and the Country Programme Evaluation contributing to a well-informed, participatory and comprehensive process of formulation of the CPD for 2021-25. Research, studies and evaluation underwent the QA procedures. The results-based planning, monitoring and reporting was facilitated in an on-going process including timely and evidence-based submissions to the audit, donors and partners. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
